subject: Photography
title: Family Photography and Social Norms
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Family Photography and Social Norms.

hook.text: The perfect family holiday photo: matching outfits, forced smiles, curated happiness. Who is it for?

buildup.text: Family photography documents milestones: births, birthdays, weddings. It creates a visible narrative of togetherness.

discovery.text: These photos often present an idealized version of family life â€” happy, harmonious, complete â€” regardless of reality.

twist.text: What's not photographed is as revealing as what is. Divorces, conflicts, and losses are usually absent from albums.

climax.text: Family photographs are performed. They show the family we want to be â€” which isn't always the family we are.

punchline.text: The family album is a story. Not all of it is true.
